intro: Lophion rostratum, commonly known as the rostrated lophion, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spurred petals that give it a unique appearance. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
